body_html:
@fmassa Sorry for a bit off this issue. I failed quite a while to use gather() for this purpose. Do you have some ideas how this going to be work, it is also on Discuss forum.

# Numpy version
a = np.random.randn(5, 4, 3, 3)
a[range(5), :, [0, 1, 1, 2, 0], [1, 2, 0, 1, 0]]
a.shape -> [5, 4]

# PyTorch
b = torch.from_numpy(a)
b.gather(dim=[2, 3], torch.LongTensor([[0, 1, 1, 2, 0], [1, 2, 0, 1, 0]]))
body_text:
@fmassa  Sorry for a bit off this issue. I failed quite a while to use gather() for this purpose. Do you have some ideas how this going to be work, it is also on Discuss forum.
# Numpy version
a = np.random.randn(5, 4, 3, 3)
a[range(5), :, [0, 1, 1, 2, 0], [1, 2, 0, 1, 0]]
a.shape -> [5, 4]

# PyTorch
b = torch.from_numpy(a)
b.gather(dim=[2, 3], torch.LongTensor([[0, 1, 1, 2, 0], [1, 2, 0, 1, 0]]))
body:
@fmassa  Sorry for a bit off this issue. I failed quite a while to use `gather()` for this purpose. Do you have some ideas how this going to be work, it is also on [Discuss forum](https://discuss.pytorch.org/t/4d-tensor-indexing-with-gather/1320). 

```
# Numpy version
a = np.random.randn(5, 4, 3, 3)
a[range(5), :, [0, 1, 1, 2, 0], [1, 2, 0, 1, 0]]
a.shape -> [5, 4]

# PyTorch
b = torch.from_numpy(a)
b.gather(dim=[2, 3], torch.LongTensor([[0, 1, 1, 2, 0], [1, 2, 0, 1, 0]]))
```
